message.content:
cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.EC, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of designing revenue-maximizing auctions, which is a classic topic in algorithmic game theory (cs.GT) and computational social choice (cs.DS). The focus on flexible consumers and their private information suggests a connection to mechanism design and auction theory (cs.EC). The use of integer programming and integral equations in the characterization of the optimal auction suggests a connection to optimization and mathematical programming (cs.LG). Finally, the paper's emphasis on nested flexibility sets and the simplification of the optimal auction suggests a connection to machine learning and decision trees (cs.AI).
